meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being a subject
meanings.sent1: Her subjectivities influenced her opinions on the matter.
meanings.sent2: The book explores the different subjectivities of its characters.
meanings.sent3: His subjectivities about ice cream flavors are quite unique.
meanings.sent4: The subjectivities of the students painted a colorful picture of diversity.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the subjectivities of the crowd in a stunning painting.

meanings.definition: The state of having individual perspectives or experiences
meanings.sent1: Their subjectivities shaped how they viewed the world.
meanings.sent2: Understanding different subjectivities can lead to empathy.
meanings.sent3: The subjectivities of cats and dogs can be quite amusing to observe.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of subjectivities, finding common ground can be challenging.
meanings.sent5: The subjectivities of the twins made it hard to tell them apart.

meanings.sent1: Their subjectivities were in conflict with each other.
meanings.sent2: The subjectivities of the group varied greatly.
meanings.sent3: The subjectivities of the team members made decision-making a challenge.
meanings.sent4: In a room full of subjectivities, finding consensus was difficult.
meanings.sent5: The subjectivities of the committee members clashed during the meeting.
